characters.name: Dr. Jonathan Swift
characters.description: Author of the proposal, identified as the writer

characters.name: American acquaintance
characters.description: A knowledgeable American living in London who informed Swift about child consumption

characters.name: Principal gentleman in the county of Cavan
characters.description: A gentleman who provided information about children's criminal activities

characters.name: Prime minister of state
characters.description: The emperor's prime minister who bought human flesh

characters.name: Girl of fifteen
characters.description: A girl who was crucified for attempting to poison the Emperor

characters.name: The Pretender
characters.description: Political figure in Spain that Irish children fight for

characters.name: inhabitants of Topinamboo
characters.description: People from Topinamboo, used for comparison

characters.name: Very worthy person
characters.description: A friend who suggested using older children as food

characters.name: Psalmanaazor
characters.description: A native of Formosa who told stories about eating human flesh in his country

characters.name: French physician
characters.description: A physician who wrote about birth patterns related to diet

characters.name: Emperor
characters.description: The emperor of Formosa mentioned in Psalmanaazor's story

characters.name: Executioner
characters.description: The person who sold human carcasses in Formosa

characters.name: vintners
characters.description: Tavern owners who would prepare and serve the proposed food

characters.name: fine gentlemen
characters.description: Wealthy men who value themselves on their knowledge of good eating

characters.name: men
characters.description: Husbands who would become fond of their pregnant wives

characters.name: skilful cook
characters.description: A cook who understands how to please guests

characters.name: mothers
characters.description: Women who would care for their children with increased tenderness

characters.name: women
characters.description: Women who would compete to bring the fattest child to market

characters.name: wives
characters.description: Married women, particularly when pregnant

characters.name: Lord Mayor
characters.description: Official who would host feasts

characters.name: reader
characters.description: The intended audience of the proposal

characters.name: Laplanders
characters.description: People from Lapland, used for comparison

characters.name: Jews
characters.description: Referenced as fighting among themselves during siege

characters.name: landlords
characters.description: Property owners who should show mercy to tenants

characters.name: shopkeepers
characters.description: Merchants who cheat and exact upon customers

characters.name: author
characters.description: The narrator/proposer of the scheme, has a wife and children

characters.name: wife
characters.description: The author's wife, past child-bearing age

book_metadata.title: and for making them beneficial to the publick.
book_metadata.author: Dr. Jonathan Swift
